com.bluecraft.hmm.util
Class DomParserFactory

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.bluecraft.hmm.util.DomParserFactory
public class DomParserFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements XmlParserList

DomParserFactory is a wrapper class for XML parsers. This class exposes only DOM interfaces. (e.g. SAX interfaces are hidden regardless of parsers used.) Currently, only sun and ibm parsers are included in order to facilitate easy distribution.

Version:
0.3
Author:
Hyoungsoo Yoon

Method Detail

setParser

public static void setParser(java.lang.String name)
Selects the parser to be used. Parser name is defined in the interface, XmlParserList.
Parameters:
name - Name of the parser to be created.

newDocument

public static org.w3c.dom.Document newDocument()
Creates a new (empty) document. It calls the constructor of appropriate (sub)class according to the parser selected (PARSER_NAME).
Returns:
org.w3c.dom.Document if successful, otherwise null.

newLocalDocument

public static org.w3c.dom.Document newLocalDocument(java.lang.String fileName)
Creates a new (empty) document with the given file name. It calls the constructor of appropriate (sub)class according to the parser selected (PARSER_NAME).
Parameters:
fileName - name of an XML file to be associated with the document.
Returns:
org.w3c.dom.Document if successful, otherwise null.

openLocalDocument

public static org.w3c.dom.Document openLocalDocument(java.lang.String fileName)
Opens a document with the given file name. It calls the constructor of appropriate (sub)class according to the parser selected (PARSER_NAME).
Parameters:
fileName - name of an XML file to be associated with the document.
Returns:
org.w3c.dom.Document if successful, otherwise null.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
This function is provided for testing purposes. First, it sets the parser, then opens a local document, and finally perfoms operations defined by DOM interfaces. No error checking is done.
